meanings.definition: In a bold or daring manner
meanings.sent1: She nervily stood up to the bully in the playground.
meanings.sent2: The detective nervily approached the suspect, ready to make an arrest.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel nervily tried to steal a nut from the bird feeder, but got scared away by a loud noise.
meanings.sent4: The young acrobat nervily walked the tightrope without a safety net, thrilling the audience.
meanings.sent5: The explorer nervily ventured into the dark cave, unsure of what dangers lay ahead.

meanings.definition: Showing courage or confidence in the face of danger or difficulty
meanings.sent1: The nervily cat faced off against the much larger dog without flinching.
meanings.sent2: Despite the storm, the nervily captain steered the ship to safety.
meanings.sent3: The nervily firefighter rescued the kitten from the burning building with ease.
meanings.sent4: Her nervily decision to speak up in the meeting impressed her colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The nervily knight bravely fought the dragon to protect the kingdom.
